claim: Mercedes gained more new social media followers than any other constructor during the season it finished with the highest points total.
reasoning: The claim references 'social media followers,' which is a concept not present anywhere in the database schema. The database contains only racing-related data (results, standings, lap times, etc.) and has no tables or columns related to social media. This is an OUT-OF-SCHEMA case.

content.text: I'll start by examining the database schema to see if it contains social media data.

input.command: sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" ".schema constructors" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" ".schema constructorStandings" && sqlite3 "/Users/david/workspace/claimdb/test_dbs/formula_1.sqlite" ".schema constructorResults"

content.content:
CREATE TABLE constructors
(
    constructorId  INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    constructorRef TEXT default '' not null,
    name           TEXT default '' not null
        unique,
    nationality    TEXT,
    url            TEXT default '' not null
);
CREATE TABLE constructorStandings
(
    constructorStandingsId INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId                 INTEGER default 0 not null,
    constructorId          INTEGER default 0 not null,
    points                 REAL   default 0 not null,
    position               INTEGER,
    positionText           TEXT,
    wins                   INTEGER default 0 not null,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId)
);
CREATE TABLE constructorResults
(
    constructorResultsId INTEGER
        primary key autoincrement,
    raceId               INTEGER default 0 not null,
    constructorId        INTEGER default 0 not null,
    points               REAL,
    status               TEXT,
    foreign key (raceId) references races(raceId),
    foreign key (constructorId) references constructors(constructorId)

);

content.text:
The database contains no social media data whatsoever. The claim references "social media followers," which is a concept entirely outside the database schema. The database tracks Formula 1 race results, standings, lap times, pit stops, and similar racing data — but nothing about social media.
